18.84. Let π be a set of primes. We say that a finite group is a BSπ-group if every conjugacy class in this group any two elements of which generate a π-subgroup itself generates a π-subgroup. Is every normal subgroup of a BSπ-group a BSπ-group?
In the case 2 ̸∈ π, an affirmative answer follows from (D. O. Revin, Siberian Math. J., 52, no. 2 (2011), 340–347).
D. O. Revin
